#  All that for a drop of blood
Here we needed to confirm to the server that i am a OASISPlayer , i first tried to do it by changing the payload but that didn't work, then i tried to add a request header file (from extension named Requestly) with tha value "OASISPlayer" but that wasn't working wither because the header name was "Authorization" , so i tried different names available on the list (in the extension) and was able to find the correct header name which was "user-agent".
The next part was giving the name of the student project which is cryptonite using a url parameter.
`/game?name=cryptonite`
and the next part was adding another rank parameter with current CTF rank of cryptonite which is 4 with the endpoint `/givemetheFlag`
`/givemetheFlag?name=cryptonite&rank=4`

HAD NO PREVIOUS KNOWLEDGE OF HEADER FILES OR URL PARAMETERS.

# I am Optimus Prime
We got a clue after raising tickets that it was related to HTTP requests, upon trying the `/robots.txt` we came to know 
```
\User-agent: *
Disallow: /hiddenFlag
```
We got to know that the flag is in https://blogpost.oasis.cryptonite.live/hiddenFlag , which on entering said
`# Method Not Allowed`
So i first i looked all of the HTTP requests allowed using `HEAD` request , and the requests allowed were 
```vishad@VISHAD:~$ curl -I HEAD https://blogpost.oasis.cryptonite.live/hiddenFlag
curl: (6) Could not resolve host: HEAD
HTTP/2 405
age: 0
allow: PATCH, POST, PUT, OPTIONS
cache-control: public, max-age=0, must-revalidate
content-type: text/html; charset=utf-8
date: Wed, 09 Oct 2024 14:08:16 GMT
server: Vercel
strict-transport-security: max-age=63072000
x-vercel-cache: MISS
x-vercel-id: bom1::iad1::j7ql9-1728482896054-3f9c7c60dd84
content-length: 0
```
`PATCH, POST, PUT, OPTIONS` , upon trying each of these , i found the flag using `OPTIONS`

HAD NO PREVIOUS KNOWLEDGE OF HTTP REQUESTS BUT KNEW ABOUT ROBOTS.TXT

# Keanu crack the matrix
Upon looking at the program carefully, i understood that we needed just needed to do `k - c[i][j]` to get the `character` for that row (total 36 rows in total) , now the only part left was to get the value of `k` as the values of `c[i][j]` were given in the file
From this 
`for i,key in zip(range(1, x*x + 1, x),keys): c.append([((-1)*j) for j in range(i,i+x)])`
we can tell that the first column of c[i][j] is an AP of the form 1,37,73....
and the general form 1 + (n-1)*36
So we can calculate the value of `k` by doing `c[i][j]` + `1 + (i-1)*36`
So for any row we first calculate the value of `k` using it's first element and then the value of `character` using it's diagonal element.
Here's the code:
```bash
out = [[579885124647369526078, 579885124647369526155, 579885124647369526154, 579885124647369526153, 579885124647369526152, 579885124647369526151, 579885124647369526150, 579885124647369526149,     key = out[i][0] + 1 + (i)*36
    print(chr(key-out[i][i]),end="")
```
AND here's the output
```bash
OASIS{Bro_Really_Modded_It_Negative}
```
HAD PREVIOUS EXPERIENCE OF REVERSING A DECRYPTED CODE BECAUSE OF PREVIOUS CRYPTONITE CHALLENGE

# A tough nut to crack
First we had to decompile the file, i used `decompyle6` for that and then i read the enc file in binary mode using `open('encrypted_file.enc', 'rb')`
reverse engineering was easy because random.seed(0) was 0. 
```
import random
ls = [72, 64, 56, 71, 59, 211, 212, 176, 233, 4, 26, 102, 231, 81, 24, 156, 62, 59, 48, 7, 96, 1, 115, 28, 60, 194]
array = [ 32, 16, 19, 17, 14, 47, 37, 44, 40, 40, 38, 16, 20,33, 19, 7, 42, 11, 27, 3, 40, 11, 38, 46, 28, 38, 25, 15, 39, 44, 30, 31, 21, 45, 26, 9, 37, 46, 13, 7, 44, 27, 41, 25, 46, 46, 23, 4, 33, 32, 3, 11, 18, 3, 7, 3, 15, 34, 45, 50, 13, 19, 2, 35, 27, 6, 14, 5, 36, 27, 10, 35, 33, 17, 23, 37, 37, 5, 19, 10, 45, 16, 36, 2, 10, 48, 3, 44, 16, 14, 8, 19, 20, 42, 8, 35, 7, 32, 14, 19, 45, 45, 38, 42, 38, 27, 39, 8, 13, 25, 27, 8, 8, 30, 13, 11, 45, 36, 24, 6, 30, 4, 13, 49, 9, 5, 47, 9, 5, 5, 49, 42, 6, 28, 34, 20, 25, 49, 12, 50, 46, 6, 26, 11, 7, 27, 28, 28, 41, 47, 1, 11, 25, 25, 49, 39, 43, 48, 21, 26, 11, 1, 4, 28, 45, 47, 4, 23, 35, 4, 29, 45, 34, 16, 17, 36, 1, 42, 24, 20, 23, 26, 14, 38, 8, 7, 10, 41, 29, 26, 3, 19, 49, 47, 3, 47, 43, 26, 6, 40, 1, 39, 37, 27, 33, 21, 5, 47, 22, 18, 49, 38, 41, 18, 50, 43, 15, 37, 10, 39, 40, 30, 6, 10, 5, 36, 14, 2, 22, 46, 28, 21, 8, 35, 47, 6, 46, 11, 24, 42, 12, 31, 46, 2, 6, 30, 16, 30, 41, 3, 12, 42, 38, 42, 45,  29, 17, 3, 11, 26, 7, 22, 11, 31, 27, 5, 23, 12, 7, 39, 18, 31, 13, 22, 3, 42, 41, 34, 16, 7, 14, 28, 2, 29, 4, 16, 27, 48, 18, 16, 1, 11, 34, 27, 42, 29, 49, 27, 13, 7]
random.seed(0)
for i in range(len(ls)):
    x=random.randint(1,100)
    y=random.choice(array)
    print(chr((ls[i]^(i+x))-y),end="")
```
Here ls is the list of integers we get when we read the enc file in binary mode.
Here's the output of this code
```
OASIS{py_X0R_08fu5c4710N5}
```

# Arte-Miss?
In this challenge, i first tried to calculate the dimensions of the image and do arithmetic operations on them to get the required flag but that was not the case , then i just tried to open the file with notepad , and got my answer there.
`OASIS{m4ta_af_04515}`
